intro: Melampodium bibracteatum, commonly known as the golden crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of smaller, tubular flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Melampodium bibracteatum is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
